page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: Donemana being situated in the middle of a predominantly sheep rearing area, has the largest sheep market in Northern Ireland.It caters for approx 80,000 sheep annually.In July and August a total of 20,000 sheep go through the sales ring,in April a mere 400 sheep are handled.The farmers bring their sheep from Dungiven, Plumbridge and Claudy to sell.Many of these make their way by lorries, each carrying 360 sheep, to factories in the Republic. The sheep are sold by the kilo and the average price is Â£1.85 per kilo.The market employs ten men,one being Mr Rankin the Auctioneer.
